location: Sector 12, Building 7 common area, Reed's apartment

knows: Harris spoke directly to benefactor on TV
Reed Salazar.emotional_state: Angry, defiant, choosing to fight, documenting everything for the record

knows: Someone with capital is running it
Executive Harris.emotional_state: Genuinely believes he's right, concerned for 'pre-prosperous' citizens, paternalistic

knows: They're happy but being called crisis

revealed_to_reader: First corporate media hit piece airs on CMN
Broadcast frames Sector 12 as 'labor defection event' and crisis
ProspectCafe lost 30% of overnight workforce
Corporate interviews managers, not actual residents
Uses fake Sector 12 resident (corporate plant) who claims crime up
Actual crime is down 67% per Marcus
Dr. Evan Harris is actually Executive Director Harris, Economic Policy Advisor
Harris acknowledges 'irregular transfers' exist
Corporate presenting productivity metrics showing decline
Metrics dishonest: measure exploitation not wellbeing
Director Wu announces 'support measures' (actually punishments)
Measures: cut services, harder prosperity scores, investigate finances, make life worse
Corporate framing: 'prosperity erosion,' 'entitlement,' 'handouts'
Four hit pieces air over one week
Online discourse divided - some sectors questioning
Harris speaks directly to benefactor on camera: 'Stop'
Corporate doing financial forensics, close to finding source
Reed increases payment from 2,000 to 2,500 to offset corporate sabotage
Reed sends message to recipients about cost of living adjustment
Reed documenting all propaganda for future record

planted.significance: These will be implemented and Sector 12 will feel the squeeze
This is how they eventually identify Reed
Personal relationship begins, leads to the offer
This becomes his legacy data and final video

continuity_notes: Common area established as gathering place
CMN (Corporate Media Network) is main propaganda outlet
Jennifer Wu is Director of Resource Allocation

voice_check.Reed: Deadpan commentary ('Oh good, we're entitled now'), bitter translation of corporate speak, rage breaking through exhaustion - check
voice_check.Harris: Corporate euphemisms throughout ('pre-prosperous', 'prosperity erosion', 'irregular transfers'), friendly tone ordering cruelty, genuinely believes his own propaganda - check
voice_check.Marcus Venn (anchor): Professional sympathy, 'concerned but not distressed' - check
voice_check.Yuki: Direct emotional response, defending their transformation - check
voice_check.Marcus Ibrahim: Strategic analysis, recognizes patterns, 'In my experience' implied - check

themes_explored: Corporate framing of liberation as crisis
Work as dignity (corporate myth) vs work as coercion (reality)
corporate_propaganda_techniques: Present dishonest but technically accurate statistics
Ignore contradictory data (crime down, health up)
Appeal to shared values (dignity, community) while meaning opposite
